trans-unit.source: Child runbooks in Azure Automation | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Child runbooks in Azure Automation | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes the different methods for starting a runbook in Azure Automation from another runbook and sharing information between them.
trans-unit.target: Describes the different methods for starting a runbook in Azure Automation from another runbook and sharing information between them.

trans-unit.source: Child runbooks in Azure Automation
trans-unit.target: Child runbooks in Azure Automation

trans-unit.source: It is a best practice in Azure Automation to write reusable, modular runbooks with a discrete function that can be used by other runbooks.
trans-unit.target: It is a best practice in Azure Automation to write reusable, modular runbooks with a discrete function that can be used by other runbooks.

trans-unit.source: A parent runbook will often call one or more child runbooks to perform required functionality.
trans-unit.target: A parent runbook will often call one or more child runbooks to perform required functionality.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to call a child runbook, and each has distinct differences that you should understand so that you can determine which will be best for your different scenarios.
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to call a child runbook, and each has distinct differences that you should understand so that you can determine which will be best for your different scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Invoking a child runbook using inline execution
trans-unit.target: Invoking a child runbook using inline execution

trans-unit.source: To invoke a runbook inline from another runbook, you use the name of the runbook and provide values for its parameters exactly like you would use an activity or cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To invoke a runbook inline from another runbook, you use the name of the runbook and provide values for its parameters exactly like you would use an activity or cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: All runbooks in the same Automation account are available to all others to be used in this manner.
trans-unit.target: All runbooks in the same Automation account are available to all others to be used in this manner.

trans-unit.source: The parent runbook will wait for the child runbook to complete before moving to the next line, and any output is returned directly to the parent.
trans-unit.target: The parent runbook will wait for the child runbook to complete before moving to the next line, and any output is returned directly to the parent.

trans-unit.source: When you invoke a runbook inline, it runs in the same job as the parent runbook.
trans-unit.target: When you invoke a runbook inline, it runs in the same job as the parent runbook.

trans-unit.source: There will be no indication in the job history of the child runbook that it ran.
trans-unit.target: There will be no indication in the job history of the child runbook that it ran.

trans-unit.source: Any exceptions and any stream output from the child runbook will be associated with the parent.
trans-unit.target: Any exceptions and any stream output from the child runbook will be associated with the parent.

trans-unit.source: This results in fewer jobs and makes them easier to track and to troubleshoot since any exceptions thrown by the child runbook and any of its stream output are associated with the parent job.
trans-unit.target: This results in fewer jobs and makes them easier to track and to troubleshoot since any exceptions thrown by the child runbook and any of its stream output are associated with the parent job.

trans-unit.source: When a runbook is published, any child runbooks that it calls must already be published.
trans-unit.target: When a runbook is published, any child runbooks that it calls must already be published.

trans-unit.source: This is because Azure Automation builds an association with any child runbooks when a runbook is compiled.
trans-unit.target: This is because Azure Automation builds an association with any child runbooks when a runbook is compiled.

trans-unit.source: If they aren’t, the parent runbook will appear to publish properly, it but will generate an exception when it’s started.
trans-unit.target: If they aren’t, the parent runbook will appear to publish properly, it but will generate an exception when it’s started.

trans-unit.source: If this happens, you can republish the parent runbook in order to properly reference the child runbooks.
trans-unit.target: If this happens, you can republish the parent runbook in order to properly reference the child runbooks.

trans-unit.source: You do not need to republish the parent runbook if any of the child runbooks are changed because the association will have already been created.
trans-unit.target: You do not need to republish the parent runbook if any of the child runbooks are changed because the association will have already been created.

trans-unit.source: The parameters of a child runbook called inline can be any data type including complex objects, and there is no <link><linkText>JSON serialization</linkText><title></title></link> as there is when you start the runbook using the Azure Management Portal or with the Start-AzureAutomationRunbook cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: The parameters of a child runbook called inline can be any data type including complex objects, and there is no <link><linkText>JSON serialization</linkText><title></title></link> as there is when you start the runbook using the Azure Management Portal or with the Start-AzureAutomationRunbook cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: The following example invokes a test child runbook that accepts three parameters, a complex object, an integer, and a boolean.
trans-unit.target: The following example invokes a test child runbook that accepts three parameters, a complex object, an integer, and a boolean.

trans-unit.source: The output of the child runbook is assigned to a variable.
trans-unit.target: The output of the child runbook is assigned to a variable.

trans-unit.source: Starting a child runbook using cmdlet
trans-unit.target: Starting a child runbook using cmdlet

trans-unit.source: You can use the <link><linkText>Start-AzureAutomationRunbook</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet to start a runbook as described in <link><linkText>To start a runbook with Windows PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <link><linkText>Start-AzureAutomationRunbook</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet to start a runbook as described in <link><linkText>To start a runbook with Windows PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: When you start a child runbook from a cmdlet, the parent runbook will move to the next line as soon as the job is created for the child runbook.
trans-unit.target: When you start a child runbook from a cmdlet, the parent runbook will move to the next line as soon as the job is created for the child runbook.

trans-unit.source: If you need to retrieve any output from the runbook, then you need to access the job using <link><linkText>Get-AzureAutomationJobOutput</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you need to retrieve any output from the runbook, then you need to access the job using <link><linkText>Get-AzureAutomationJobOutput</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The job from a child runbook started with a cmdlet will run in a separate job from the parent runbook.
trans-unit.target: The job from a child runbook started with a cmdlet will run in a separate job from the parent runbook.

trans-unit.source: This results in more jobs than invoking the script inline and makes them more difficult to track.
trans-unit.target: This results in more jobs than invoking the script inline and makes them more difficult to track.

trans-unit.source: The parent can start multiple child runbooks though without waiting for each to complete.
trans-unit.target: The parent can start multiple child runbooks though without waiting for each to complete.

trans-unit.source: For that same kind of parallel execution calling the child runbooks inline, the parent runbook would need to use the <link><linkText>parallel keyword</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For that same kind of parallel execution calling the child runbooks inline, the parent runbook would need to use the <link><linkText>parallel keyword</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Parameters for a child runbook started with a cmdlet are provided as a hashtable as described in <link><linkText>Runbook Parameters</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Parameters for a child runbook started with a cmdlet are provided as a hashtable as described in <link><linkText>Runbook Parameters</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Only simple data types can be used.
trans-unit.target: Only simple data types can be used.

trans-unit.source: If the runbook has a parameter with a complex data type, then it must be called inline.
trans-unit.target: If the runbook has a parameter with a complex data type, then it must be called inline.

trans-unit.source: The following example starts a child runbook with parameters and then waits for it to complete.
trans-unit.target: The following example starts a child runbook with parameters and then waits for it to complete.

trans-unit.source: Once completed, its output is collected from the job by the parent runbook.
trans-unit.target: Once completed, its output is collected from the job by the parent runbook.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Start-ChildRunbook</linkText><title></title></link> is a helper runbook available in the TechNet Gallery to start a runbook from a cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Start-ChildRunbook</linkText><title></title></link> is a helper runbook available in the TechNet Gallery to start a runbook from a cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: This provides the option of waiting until the child runbook has completed and retrieving its output.
trans-unit.target: This provides the option of waiting until the child runbook has completed and retrieving its output.

trans-unit.source: In addition to using this runbook in your own Azure Automation environment, this runbook can be used as a reference for working with runbooks and jobs using cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: In addition to using this runbook in your own Azure Automation environment, this runbook can be used as a reference for working with runbooks and jobs using cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: The helper runbook itself must be called inline because it requires a hashtable parameter to accept the parameter values for the child runbook.
trans-unit.target: The helper runbook itself must be called inline because it requires a hashtable parameter to accept the parameter values for the child runbook.

trans-unit.source: Comparison of methods for calling a child runbook
trans-unit.target: Comparison of methods for calling a child runbook

trans-unit.source: The following table summarizes the differences between the two methods for calling a runbook from another runbook.
trans-unit.target: The following table summarizes the differences between the two methods for calling a runbook from another runbook.

trans-unit.source: Inline
trans-unit.target: Inline

trans-unit.source: Cmdlet
trans-unit.target: Cmdlet

trans-unit.source: Job
trans-unit.target: Job

trans-unit.source: Child runbooks run in the same job as the parent.
trans-unit.target: Child runbooks run in the same job as the parent.

trans-unit.source: A separate job is created for the child runbook.
trans-unit.target: A separate job is created for the child runbook.

trans-unit.source: Execution
trans-unit.target: Execution

trans-unit.source: Parent runbook waits for the child runbook to complete before continuing.
trans-unit.target: Parent runbook waits for the child runbook to complete before continuing.

trans-unit.source: Parent runbook continues immediately after child runbook is started.
trans-unit.target: Parent runbook continues immediately after child runbook is started.

trans-unit.source: Output
trans-unit.target: Output

trans-unit.source: Parent runbook can directly get output from child runbook.
trans-unit.target: Parent runbook can directly get output from child runbook.

trans-unit.source: Parent runbook must retrieve output from child runbook job.
trans-unit.target: Parent runbook must retrieve output from child runbook job.

trans-unit.source: Parameters
trans-unit.target: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Values for the child runbook parameters are specified separately and can use any data type.
trans-unit.target: Values for the child runbook parameters are specified separately and can use any data type.

trans-unit.source: Values for the child runbook parameters must be combined into a single hashtable and can only include simple, array, and object data types that leverage JSON serialization.
trans-unit.target: Values for the child runbook parameters must be combined into a single hashtable and can only include simple, array, and object data types that leverage JSON serialization.

trans-unit.source: Automation Account
trans-unit.target: Automation Account

trans-unit.source: Parent runbook can only use child runbook in the same automation account.
trans-unit.target: Parent runbook can only use child runbook in the same automation account.

trans-unit.source: Parent runbook can use child runbook from any automation account from the same Azure subscription and even a different subscription if you have a connection to it.
trans-unit.target: Parent runbook can use child runbook from any automation account from the same Azure subscription and even a different subscription if you have a connection to it.

trans-unit.source: Publishing
trans-unit.target: Publishing

trans-unit.source: Child runbook must be published before parent runbook is published.
trans-unit.target: Child runbook must be published before parent runbook is published.

trans-unit.source: Child runbook must be published any time before parent runbook is started.
trans-unit.target: Child runbook must be published any time before parent runbook is started.
